repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: In some cases, there may be following error:

comment_regular_data.body: The failed CI seems have nothing to do with the PR.

Why would the buffer id be invalid in a BufNewFile autocommand? This seems like a bug somewhere else that should be fixed instead of just burying it.

Can you provide a reproduction case for this error?

I use `vim-plug` to manage plugins.

Install [lewis6991/fileline.nvim](https://github.com/lewis6991/fileline.nvim), execute `PlugUpdate fileline.nvim`, then try to open file with line number like `:e ~/.vimrc:30`. The error occured.

I think this happens because fileline.nvim calls `nvim_buf_delete` in the `BufNewFile` autocmd.

```lua
local function reopen_and_gotoline(file_name, lnum, col)
  local bufn = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()

  vim.cmd.edit{vim.fn.fnameescape(file_name), mods = { keepalt = true }}

  vim.api.nvim_buf_delete(bufn, {})

  vim.api.nvim_win_set_cursor(0, { lnum, col and col - 1 or 0 })

  if vim.fn.foldlevel(lnum) > 0 then
    vim.cmd.normal{'zv', bang = true }
  end
  vim.cmd.normal{'zz', bang = true }

  vim.cmd.filetype('detect')
end
```

So it deletes the `file:30` buffer and reopens a new buffer `file` at line `30`.

> So it deletes the `file:30` buffer and reopens a new buffer `file` at line `30`.

The behavior make sense since buffer `file` at line `30` is the actual need.

Seems there is reasonable scene which may cause invalid buffer id.

I'm trying to see if fileline can reuse the buffer, but I'm not sure if it's possible.

EDIT: I'm pretty sure it isn't possible.

If we decide that deleting buffers in `BufNewFile` should not be supported, then we enforce this internally and raise an error. Otherwise, I think this PR is ok.

The only thing I can think to do in fileline.nvim would be to defer `nvim_buf_delete` via `vim.schedule`. EDIT:  I've done this anyway in case it messes up any other `BufNewFile` autocmds.

>If we decide that deleting buffers in BufNewFile should not be supported, then we enforce this internally and raise an error. Otherwise, I think this PR is ok.

Yea, I think ideally if a buffer is deleted or becomes invalid in one autocommand then later autocommands shouldn't fire at all.
Git push to origin failed for release-0.9 with exitcode 1

title: fix(filetype): make sure buffer is valid before call nvim_buf_call
